all: The park has been at the center of allegations of corruption and misspent funds that threaten to embroil the junta. Dozens of students activists were arrested on Dec. 7 while trying to protest against alleged army corruption after a train they were traveling on was intercepted. Police spokesman Police Major General Piyaphand Pingmuang said police summoned the group after the junta, or National Council for Peace and Order, filed a complaint. Thai people pay their respect to giant bronze statues of former King Ram Khamhaeng after a religious ceremony at Ratchapakdi Park in Hua Hin, Prachuap Khiri Khan province, Thailand, July 27, 2015. "The junta is using the law as a tool for political purposes," said Anon Nampha, a rights lawyer and one of the 11 people summoned.
title: Eleven activists summoned amid deepening Thai park scandal
summary: The park has been at the center of allegations of corruption and misspent funds that threaten to emb...

all: A Renesas Electronics Corp's chip is pictured at the company's office in Tokyo March 21, 2013. The logo of Renesas Electronics Corp is pictured at the company's headquarters in Tokyo, Japan, December 21, 2015. Over $80 billion worth of M&As have been announced in 2015 including NXP Semiconductors NV's (NXPI.O) purchase of Freescale Semiconductor Inc, and ON Semiconductor Corp's (ON.O) deal for Fairchild Semiconductor International Inc (FCS.O). Renesas' Endo said a capital tie-up of some form with Infineon was possible. "I don't think INCJ would sell a majority of Renesas shares to overseas buyers," Renesas Chief Executive Takao Endo told Reuters in an interview on Monday.
title: Renesas CEO says acquisition by Infineon unlikely
summary: A Renesas Electronics Corp's chip is pictured at the company's office in Tokyo March 21, 2013. The l...

all: "The increase in rig count even in a low crude oil price environment suggests shale producers are committed to maintaining production levels. "The U.S. oil rig count bounced back this week, up by 17 (to 541), putting an end to four consecutive weekly declines," Goldman Sachs said. This comes only days after the U.S. voted to lift a 40-year-old ban on crude exports which could see some of its excess production dumped on the global market. Stacked rigs are seen along with other idled oil drilling equipment at a depot in Dickinson, North Dakota June 26, 2015. Both benchmarks are down more than two-thirds since mid-2014 when the rout began.
title: Brent crude falls almost 2 percent to 2004 low as market rout heads into Christmas
summary: "The increase in rig count even in a low crude oil price environment suggests shale producers are co...

all: The company logo of Panasonic Corp is seen at CEATEC (Combined Exhibition of Advanced Technologies) JAPAN 2015 in Makuhari, Japan, October 6, 2015. TOKYO Japanese electronics maker Panasonic Corp (6752.T) has agreed to buy a majority stake in U.S. refrigeration systems maker Hussmann from a private equity firm for over 150 billion yen ($1.2 billion), people familiar with the matter said on Monday. Panasonic agreed to buy the stake from Clayton Dubilier & Rice, said the people, who declined to be identified as they were not authorized to speak with media on the matter. Clayton Dubilier & Rice bought the stake from industrial conglomerate Ingersoll-Rand PLC (IR.N) in 2011. Panasonic officials were not immediately available to comment.
title: Panasonic to buy refrigeration firm Hussmann for over $1.2 billion: sources
summary: The company logo of Panasonic Corp is seen at CEATEC (Combined Exhibition of Advanced Technologies) ...
